intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium imandrense, commonly known as the Greenland hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often hairy. Hieracium imandrense plays a role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain herbivores.
